results.title: Poststreptococcal acute glomerulonephritis can be a risk factor for accelerating kidney dysfunction in Alport syndrome: a case experience.
results.text_hl: We diagnosed him with @<m>DISEASE_Acute_Disease</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000208 @@@poststreptococcal acute glomerulonephritis@@@ (@<m>DISEASE_Acute_Disease</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000208 @@@PSAGN@@@) and he was stopped treatment by @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@, and received supportive treatment.

citations.NLM: Araki Y, Kawaguchi A, Sakakibara N, Nagaoka Y, Yamamura T, Horinouchi T, Nagano C, Morisada N, Iijima K, Nozu K. Poststreptococcal acute glomerulonephritis can be a risk factor for accelerating kidney dysfunction in Alport syndrome: a case experience. CEN Case Rep. 2020 Nov;9(4):418-422. PMID: 32592137
citations.BibTeX: @article{32592137, title={Poststreptococcal acute glomerulonephritis can be a risk factor for accelerating kidney dysfunction in Alport syndrome: a case experience.}, author={Araki Y and Kawaguchi A and Sakakibara N and Nagaoka Y and Yamamura T and Horinouchi T and Nagano C and Morisada N and Iijima K and Nozu K}, journal={CEN Case Rep}, volume={9}, number={4}, pages={418-422}}

results.title: Non-AT(1)-receptor-mediated protective effect of angiotensin against acute ischaemic stroke in the gerbil.
results.text_hl: This study confirms that @GENE_AGT @GENE_183 @@@Ang II@@@ contributes to protective mechanisms against @<m>DISEASE_Acute_Disease</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000208 @@@acute cerebral ischaemia@@@ through non AT1-receptor-mediated, BP-independent effects.

citations.NLM: Dalmay F, Mazouz H, Allard J, Pesteil F, Achard JM, Fournier A. Non-AT(1)-receptor-mediated protective effect of angiotensin against acute ischaemic stroke in the gerbil. J Renin Angiotensin Aldosterone Syst. 2001 Jun;2(2):103-6. PMID: 11881107
citations.BibTeX: @article{11881107, title={Non-AT(1)-receptor-mediated protective effect of angiotensin against acute ischaemic stroke in the gerbil.}, author={Dalmay F and Mazouz H and Allard J and Pesteil F and Achard JM and Fournier A}, journal={J Renin Angiotensin Aldosterone Syst}, volume={2}, number={2}, pages={103-6}}

results.title: Paramedic Initiated Lisinopril For Acute Stroke Treatment (PIL-FAST): study protocol for a pilot randomised controlled trial
results.text_hl: Participants receive @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ (5-10 mg) or matched placebo daily for 7 days.

citations.NLM: Shaw L, Price C, McLure S, Howel D, McColl E, Ford GA. Paramedic Initiated Lisinopril For Acute Stroke Treatment (PIL-FAST): study protocol for a pilot randomised controlled trial Trials. 2011 Jun 15;12():152. PMID: 21676221
